phase_1.name: Planning
phase_1.description: Research and work focused on early conceptual and strategic decisions made before the production or product system is realized or operational. This includes defining market needs, product concepts, high-level production planning, simulation-based feasibility assessments, capacity planning, and technological evaluation before implementation. Scientific work in this phase typically proposes new theories, frameworks, or decision support methods without using operational data from a running system. Validation may be limited to hypothetical case studies, simulations, or small illustrative examples. The main goal is to shape what the future production or reuse system should be.

phase_2.name: Development_Production
phase_2.description: Research and work that designs, configures, or executes the core production or service processes. This phase involves implementation-oriented development of machinery, robotics, automation technology, scheduling, execution control, workflow management, and production system architecture. The system is assumed to be in operation, under commissioning, or in active development. Scientific work in this phase investigates how to make the physical or digital manufacturing system function correctly and efficiently during execution. Experiments often involve real production environments, prototypes, digital twins, or detailed simulations representing near-real conditions.

phase_3.name: Optimization
phase_3.description: Research and work that focuses on improving efficiency, performance, quality, reliability, or safety of an already functioning production or service system. This phase assumes that data is being generated through real usage or realistic long-term operation. Typical goals include continuous improvement, parameter optimization, fault detection, anomaly diagnosis, predictive decision-making, performance prediction, maintenance strategy enhancement, and control system refinement. Scientific work in this phase typically evaluates methods using historical data, operational logs, long-term experiments, or benchmarking against existing baseline systems. The production system already exists â€” the aim is to make it better.

phase_4.name: Use_Reuse
phase_4.description: Research and work focused on the value, behavior, and lifecycle of products during active use or after end of primary use, including reuse, refurbishment, remanufacturing, recycling, and circular economy strategies. The primary objects of study are products in the field or those returning from the field. Scientific work in this phase deals with in-service monitoring, reliability assessment during use, estimation of remaining lifetime or value, and decisions related to end-of-life pathways, including environmental or economic impacts. The goal is to maximize total lifecycle value by extending usage, reducing waste, and recovering resources once products leave the factory.
